p: Histopathology findings revealed widespread necrosis was reduced to few inflammatory liver cells in the rats treated with P. odoratissimus extracts. Besides the seed part, roots part of the plant also possessed significant protection against paracetamol-induced hepatotoxicity in rats at 400 mg/kg (Mishra et al. 2015). The histopathological study showed a decrease in the degree of necrosis in the rats treated with P. odoratissimus extracts. This is due to P. odoratissimus contains hepatoprotective agents such as flavonoids, coumarin, tocopherol, and polyfunctional organic acids (Chilakwad et al. 2008; Itoh et al. 2009; Londonkar and Kamble 2009; Plundrich et al. 2015; Helkar et al. 2016).
